meanings.sent1: When you heat ice, it liquates into water.
meanings.sent2: The sun liquates the snow, turning it into a puddle.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate liquates in your hand on a hot day!
meanings.sent4: Her words liquated his frozen heart, melting away his doubts.
meanings.sent5: The candle liquates into a pool of wax, creating a warm glow.

meanings.sent1: The sugar liquates quickly in hot tea.
meanings.sent2: The salt liquates in water, disappearing completely.
meanings.sent3: His excuses liquate under scrutiny, revealing the truth.
meanings.sent4: The music liquates the tension in the room, bringing peace.

meanings.sent1: The machine liquates the mixture into its different parts.
meanings.sent2: The chemist liquates the solution to analyze its components.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick liquates the colors into a rainbow!
meanings.sent4: Time liquates memories into a bittersweet concoction.
meanings.sent5: Laughter liquates the seriousness of the situation, making it easier to handle.
